Although in limited circumstances we may use your information because you have specifically consented to it, we generally use your information in the ways set out in this notice because:
If we have acquired another business, or substantially all of its assets, which originally held your information, we will hold and use the information you provided to them, or which they otherwise held about you, in accordance with this privacy notice.
Once we have received notification that you have withdrawn your consent, we will no longer process your information for the purpose or purposes you originally agreed to, unless we have another legitimate interest in doing so.
We obtain information from the following publicly available sources: Companies House, LinkedIn and Xing.
We will also have told you for what purpose we will share and combine your data.
Your information will be kept until it is updated by that worker, or we no longer need to contact that worker after they have stopped working for us.
Your organisation should have informed you that your information would be provided to us, and directed you to this policy.

CONTRACT INFORMATION AND OTHER CORRESPONDENCE
We will keep and use that information to carry out our contract with you (if applicable), to comply with any legal requirements for us to maintain certain records or carry out certain verifications, and/or for our legitimate interests in dealing with a complaint or enquiry and administering your (or your organisation's) account or order and any services we offer, as well as to review and improve our offerings, including troubleshooting, data analysis, testing, research, statistical and survey purposes.

If you work for one of our customers, suppliers or business partners, the information we collect about you may include your contact information, details of your employment and our relationship with you.

If you are listed as an emergency contact by someone who works for us, we will hold your name, contact details and details of your relationship with that worker.

EMPLOYEE INFORMATION
We keep this information for up to seven years after the end of our relationship with your organisation.

INFORMATION COLLECTED AT OUR PREMISES
We use this information as necessary for our legitimate interests in administering your visit, ensuring site security and visitor safety, and administering parking.
We are required by law to provide metadata to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) when you use our software to help you complete and submit tax updates or returns (Making Tax Digital).

We do use third party service providers to send out our marketing, but we only allow them to use that information on our instructions and where they have agreed to treat the information confidentially and to keep it secure.
We never share your name or contact details with third parties for marketing purposes unless we have your "opt-in" consent to share your details with a specific third party for them to send you marketing.

We may collect your name and contact details (such as your email address, phone number or address) in order to send you information about our products and services which you might be interested in.

Where we store CVs which include special category data, we do so as necessary for our legitimate interests in holding a record of the application, and on the basis that the information was made available to us voluntarily.  We need to hold a record of the application for a certain time to ensure we can comply with our employment law obligations.

We may need to request specific information from you to help us understand the nature of your request, to confirm your identity and ensure your right to access the information (or to exercise any of your other rights).
If we send you any marketing emails, we will always provide an unsubscribe option to allow you to opt out of any further marketing emails.

WEBSITE INFORMATION
We keep this website information about you from when it is collected or the relevant cookie expires.
